comment: Visited this place last month. It is surely a must visit place for all those who love Italian food. The place has a nice ambiance with courteous staff and beautifully decorated interior. The pizza was kind of dry and it was constantly making me thirsty. But the concept is surely something new that I haven't tasted anywhere else before. It had Mutton keema, green chilies and lots of coriander leaves. Typical Bengali taste, on a thin crusted pizza. Quite innovative. 2. Pasta e Polpettine - It is basically Spaghetti with Meat Balls in tomato sauce. As one can understand it has a tangy taste to it and the meatballs are really well made. Wanted to try other varieties as well, but the pizza was too big and we were too full to try anything else.

author: Sumit Pandey
comment: One of the best places to have Italian cuisine in Kolkata. I had a craving for authentic Italian food and the visit to fire and ice pizzeria was totally worth it. The restaurant is exquisite and suave. They have a diverse menu with good Italian dishes ranging from soups, starters, pizza, pasta, spaghetti, lasagnas and what not. They served the dishes and they all tasted amazing. They kept it in most authentic manner possible. The pizzas baked in wood ovens had great texture and taste. The mushroom soup was out of its league of soups very buttery and smooth. They serve pasta in two versions and both white sauce ariabatta and red sauce alfredo was superb. The vegetable lasagna was very cheesy and saucy. The flavour used and sauces and spices all were just superb. Though the prices are little over the par but the quality of food and genuine recipes make this place a treat. They also have a full functional bar with all good brands of liquor available. They have a mean apple pie and chocolate mousse cake as well. In total want to have a chilled out italian treat? Enter fire n ice pizzeria.

The menu extends far beyond their signature pizzas to include everything from crostinis and bruschettas to pastas, risottos and paninis made with fresh-baked focaccia. The focus is on authentic, home-style food, the kind  nonna  makes. The only local touch to their menu is the Fire of Bengal pizza topped with spicy mutton, green chillies and coriander leaves   it is one of their bestsellers.

author: Aayati Sengupta
comment: I've been going to Fire and Ice for the last ten years on again off again. One thing that has been consistently good is their pizza. However, a lot else has slipped through the cracks. Yesterday's visit was after quite a few years. There was a temperature check and hand sanitizing at the entrance. After which we were shown to our table. The place was relatively uncrowded (we had seen jampacked restaurants on our walk from Park Street to there) which was a bonus in my book because of the pandemic. However, I was disappointed to find that the salt and pepper shakers in our table as well as the next were empty; my ginger ale was served in a can without mint leaves even though I had specified that a couple of mint leaves be provided, and the chilli oil had clearly outlived its days. The bottle of chilli oil on our table had ancient chillies and their was no heat in the oil. That was also disappointing since I was introduced to good chilli oil for pizzas at Fire and Ice only. I hope that the establishment puts in a little bit of effort into getting the place back to its original days. However, the pizza still tastes great - soft, flaky, thin crust, fresh cheese and fresh marinara and fresh ingredients!

comment: This is one of the few places in this city that have not only survived the decade but also remained at the top of their game throughout. Fire N Ice to most Calcuttans screams comfort food and is easily at the top of the list when looking for Italian food. Starting with the appetiser platter all the way to the mousse and nutella crepes at the end, all the food is amazing. For first timers, I would suggest starting with the Rondelle crisps and the appetiser platter, followed by their famous Penne Arrabbiata if you like spicy food or the Penne in Pesto. Amongst their pizzas you can choose any from the long list available, arguably the best pizza in town. With dessert is where you're truly spoilt for choice. Their nutella crepes are top of the list followed closely by the chocolate mousse and their apple pie. Both of course, with a scoop of delicious vanilla ice-cream. Fire N Ice is one place with which you cannot go wrong. Also, don't forget to have a couple of glasses of their delicious homemade lemon iced-tea.
